caption: What an absolutely beautiful church. Passed by her just by sheer luck and was so happy. The interior is probably one of the most beautiful I've ever been into. It was quite old but beautifully kept. It was packed when I went in there as I entered near the end of mass. It was so lovely to see every talking outside.

Like most of religious places in Paris is a unique historical place, I saw a stone carving from 1625 on one of the side doors. There are a lot of beautiful antiques inside despite of spiritual vibe. Nobody ask for a ticket. Parking place and bathroom not available or very hard to find. Check the pictures please.

Beautiful church in the near of the famous Notre Dame des Paris. Daily holy mass and Sundays even 5 masses with many faithful people. The mass is in the old traditional rite in Latin. The rite the church was build for.

I am Catholic and recently went to a church in Paris to pray after hearing the bell chime. To my surprise, I was quickly ushered out because I was wearing shorts. I was dressed in a plain T-shirt and shorts due to the summer heat. This experience was quite shocking, as I have never been escorted out of a church before.  I believe that the core tenet of Christianity is to come as you are, and being overly strict about dress code can be off-putting to people seeking spiritual connection. It's concerning when organized religion becomes too focused on appearance rather than the message of acceptance and love. Despite the situation, I was dressed appropriately for the weather and looked quite cute in my Orlebar Brown outfit.

Saint-Nicolas-du-Chardonnet is a church just off Saint Germain Boulevard near the Maubert - Mutualité Metro Station. Opening hours are 7am to 8.30pm daily.  Originally build in the 13th century, the church has been reconstructed a handful of times over the centuries. The exterior facade is subtle and simple, the interior features some nice side chapels with large scale frescos. The main alter and inner dome work are particularly nice to see. This section of the church was lit up during our visit by a light being shone on the Mary and Child sculpture at the main alter. Much of the rest of the interior was rather dark limiting how well you can see and photograph what is inside.  Overall, we liked our short visit to Saint-Nicolas-du-Chardonnet. It is an attractive church worth spending a few minutes to enjoy if you plan to spend time or pass through this area of Paris. It is not too far from Notre Dame Cathedral if looking for other places to combine with a visit here. If you want to stay on the Left Bank, Eglise Saint-Ephrem-le-Syriaque, Saint-Étienne-du-Mont and the Pantheon are within relatively short distance as well.

Seriously the best non-tourist church in Paris. If you want to pray and attend a real mass and get the real Sacraments. This is where you go.  If you believe in the True Presence, have Holy Fear, and want real Confession and be accountable for your life,  so that you can avoid hell, have a shorter time in Purgatory and your aim is to know,  love and Serve God in this life,  so you can be with Him in the next... go here.

Beautiful church with beautiful statues and stained glass. The vastness of the interior made me feel small (in a good way!). The Mass in Latin is always wonderfully done and listening to the choir is like listening to angels. The priests and laity are friendly too.

Beautiful church on the left bank. SSPX priests offer the traditional Latin Mass. Beautiful and vibrant parish. Very full for a weekday low mass. Average age of everyone in attendance was in late 20’s. This is the future of the Catholic Church in France.

Searched for a Latin Mass in Paris out of curiosity and found this place near where my wife and I were staying. Beautiful architecture, the Latin Mass was fascinating and inspiring. The organist and choir were very good with a great repertoire and the parishioners are friendly.
Beautiful Parisian church with the traditional Latin Mass multiple times each day!
Amazing tradition of ringing the church bells before 8am every day of the week (for a solid 5+ minutes)… I like church bells! It would be nice if they were more considerate though.

A stunning church and one where everything is just as it should be: proper confessionals, side altars in use, altar rails, statues, beautiful paintings - the lot! My friends and I were blown away. Thank you for your faith!
Solemn , only church  in Paris I visited  with the image of Sto. Nino.
beautifully preserved latin mass, gregoriant chants and a warm community - nothing else fills my heart with love like our traditional tridentine mass does✝️
A church service in Latin is Unique for a US Pastor mainly used to Gospel Music. He said: I loved the personal relationship of the people there on a week day.
13th century chapel. Beautiful in the centre of Paris.

The pearl of all churches in Paris - partly because of the preservation of Traditionalist Catholicism and the Tridentine Mass. Thanks to this, original altar is preserved and there is no new "table altar". Church is operated by the Society of Saint Pius X (SSPX).
Went to mass on December 8, 2018 and found the choir of only six men to be very beautiful as they filled the church with gloriously harmonic music.
During the summer season it's not allowed to visit church if you're wearing shorts. Crazy!

Saint-Nicolas-du-Chardonnet is a Roman Catholic church in the centre of Paris, France, located in the 5th arrondissement. Since 1977, after expelling the parish priest and his assistants the church has been used by traditionalist Society of St. Pius X and remains in the Society's hands.
So sad that Europe has lost its religion. 20 people at mass. I loved it and it felt very spiritual.
An ambulatory church with architectural/religious interests, especially the monument dedicated to Charles Le Brun.
Sobering sermon on All Souls Days. A joy to see so many young parishioners.
We stumbled across this Church on our way to another place and glad we did. Really cool one.
A place full of serenity. Visit if you need a break from the city.
Beautiful Catholic church in an attractive neighborhood.
Simple & good
The liturgy, the way it used to be. Well worth attending.
Great visit. Excellent ceiling art.
Beautiful church without the crowds.
So beautiful. The artwork is truly priceless.
Wonderful experience at this Church,
Traditional Latin Mass
Quick visit and was quite fulfilling
The organist is lovely!
Beautiful church.
Beautiful
Very impressive!
